name: CERT C Secure Coding Standard (2008) Chapter 8 - Characters and Strings (STR)
summary: Weaknesses in this category are related to the rules and recommendations in the Characters and Strings (STR) chapter of the CERT C Secure Coding Standard (2008).

previous_entry_name.text: CERT C Secure Coding Section 07 - Characters and Strings (STR)
CERT C Secure Coding (2008 Version) Section 07 - Characters and Strings (STR)

author: Robert C. Seacord
references.title: The CERT C Secure Coding Standard

notes.text:
<xhtml:p>In the 2008 version of the CERT C Secure Coding standard, the following rules were mapped to the following CWE IDs:</xhtml:p>
                  <xhtml:ul>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-78 STR02-C Sanitize data passed to complex subsystems</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-88 STR02-C Sanitize data passed to complex subsystems</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-119 STR31-C Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-119 STR32-C Null-terminate byte strings as required</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-119 STR33-C Size wide character strings correctly</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-120 STR35-C Do not copy data from an unbounded source to a fixed-length array</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-135 STR33-C Size wide character strings correctly</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-170 STR03-C Do not inadvertently truncate a null-terminated byte string</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-170 STR32-C Null-terminate byte strings as required</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-193 STR31-C Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-464 STR03-C Do not inadvertently truncate a null-terminated byte string</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-464 STR06-C Do not assume that strtok() leaves the parse string unchanged</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-686 STR37-C Arguments to character handling functions must be representable as an unsigned char</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-704 STR34-C Cast characters to unsigned types before converting to larger integer sizes</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-704 STR37-C Arguments to character handling functions must be representable as an unsigned char</xhtml:li>
                  </xhtml:ul>
